title: Daily Progress Tracker: auth, task tracking, analytics, streaks, and settings

requirements.text: Implement user authentication using Internet Identity and gate all app features behind login.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users are prompted to sign in with Internet Identity before accessing dashboards or tasks
After signing in, the UI shows the user as authenticated and can call authenticated backend methods
Signing out returns the UI to the unauthenticated state

requirements.text: Create user profile data linked to the authenticated Principal, including editable fields: display name and goal type (e.g., Study/Fitness/Coding/Other).
acceptanceCriteria: On first login, a profile record is created (or the user is prompted to complete it)
Users can view and edit their profile fields; changes persist across reloads
Profile reads/writes are scoped to the currently authenticated Principal

requirements.text: Implement task CRUD for the signed-in user: create task with title, date, status (done/pending), optional category, and optional notes; list tasks by selected date; edit and delete tasks.

acceptanceCriteria: User can add a task with a chosen date and see it in the list for that date after saving
User can toggle a task between done and pending; the change persists after refresh
User can edit task fields (title/date/category/notes/status) and delete tasks
All task operations are scoped to the authenticated user (no cross-user access)

requirements.text: Build progress analytics calculations and UI: daily completion percentage for the selected date; weekly summary; monthly summary; and total completed tasks.

acceptanceCriteria: For a selected date, the app displays completion % = done tasks / total tasks for that date (handle 0 tasks gracefully)
Weekly and monthly summaries are computed from the user‚Äôs tasks and displayed in the UI
A total completed tasks metric is displayed and matches the underlying task data

requirements.text: Implement a streak system: current daily streak count, best streak record, and logic to break a streak when a day is missed (based on days with 100% completion or at least one completed task‚Äîchoose one rule and apply consistently).

acceptanceCriteria: The dashboard shows current streak and best streak values
Streak values update when tasks are completed/uncompleted and after date changes
The chosen streak rule is clearly described in the UI (English), and computations follow that rule consistently

requirements.text: Implement export of the user‚Äôs task/progress data as a CSV download from the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: User can export to CSV from a clear UI action (e.g., Settings)
Downloaded CSV includes at least: date, title, status, category, notes

requirements.text: Add a simple motivational quotes feature: display an English quote on the dashboard (e.g., daily random from a built-in list) with an option to refresh.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows a motivational quote in English
User can refresh to get another quote
Quotes work offline (no external API required)

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (color palette, typography, spacing, and component styling) optimized for a clear, friendly productivity feel; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

quotes: Build progress daily tracker user friendly clear design app build

acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent design system (colors/typography/layout) across all screens
Primary styling does not rely on blue/purple as the main brand colors
The dashboard and task list are visually scannable (clear hierarchy, spacing, and states)

requirements.text: Render any generated static images (from imageRequirements.required) from frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI (e.g., app logo in header/auth screens and an empty-state illustration when there are no tasks).

quotes: Build progress daily tracker user friendly clear design app build

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend
At least one generated image is visible in the running app UI
No backend routing is used for serving these images

constraints: Backend must be a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose them from app code instead.
Use English for all user-facing text.
Third-party auth methods like Google OAuth and email/password are not used; authentication must use Internet Identity.
nonGoals: Firebase/Firestore, Node/Express, Django, or any external database integration.

required: Minimal productivity app logo mark, warm neutral palette, flat vector style (daily-progress-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Simple empty-state illustration of a checklist and calendar on a desk, flat vector style (empty-tasks-illustration.dim_1200x800.png)
